description: Won't map controls for steam deck
The settings window is far too tall. It obscures the "Apply" button. While emulation is great with what I've started, I would like to be able to use my Steam Deck alone.

mGBA has been a solid emulator option for a while, comprehensive settings, support for Dolphin to emulate Link Cable features in compatible titles, etc.

Anyone with issues mapping the controls on Steam Deck should be aware - Deck controls are desktop at all times until Steam gives them a specific profile. If you wanna use mGBA on Deck, add it as a non-Steam app, set Controller Layout to a Gamepad option, and run it through Steam. You have to add it to Steam anyway if you wanna play in game mode!

Rating this 5 stars based on THE APPLICATION, NOT BASED ON ANY PEBCAC.

Unfortunately it's impossible to get the application to recognize inputs when used in desktop mode, unlike most other emulators that the deck supports. The only way to get it to hear the inputs is by adding it as a non-steam title, then running it in gaming mode. The problem is selecting games when running in game mode. Clearly this wasn't designed with Deck users in mind. On top of that, navigating the settings menu is impossible due to the menu screen size being larger than the resolution of the console. Not practical in its current state.

LOTR: The Return of the King + The Third Age are way glitched out graphically. In ROTK, the puddle reflection flickers really bad, and on TTA the flank borders do the same thing. And on steam deck its pretty much broken. Sometimes it opens the file browser to pick a game, and sometimes it breaks the toolbar at the top and you can't pick anything, and there's literally no rhyme or reason to it. My emulators on android have none of these problems and run flawlessly, but on steam deck/linux even the alternatives do it too. The toolbars work on the alternatives, but the flickers still there. I'd wait until an update comes out or a decent alternative before getting this.
